@MelonyKlein No, SLT quality highly variable throughout country. I am reporting from an ATL members' meeting I went to in Cornwall last eve.
It's the variation in SLT practice -the way they treat their teacher colleagues which is so worrying. Some excellent. Others appalling.
Other ATL members in Cornwall spoke of working in well led schools with excellent SLT teams and good professional support.
ATL members in Cornwall spoke of bullying, intimidating culture in some schools - a climate of data driven fear and impossible targets.
ATL members' meeting in Cornwall - I heard tales of appallingly unprofessional SLT practices, purporting to measure teacher 'performance'.
ATL members' meeting in Cornwall - A teacher's 'performance rating' lowered-the 'class ambassador' immersed in work and did not 'greet' head
ATL members' meeting in Cornwall - a teacher graded 'amber' for performance she had not put the differentiated lesson observation on board.
ATL members' meeting in Cornwall.  Some tales: One school where pupils are put in detention if they are in groups of more than 5.
